intro: Microstylis hispaniolae, commonly known as the Hispaniola microstylis, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hispaniola. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
